bisbmHC 0.0.0.9000
  • Get started
  • Reference

Set up recursive bi-partition tree

recursive_biTree.Rd

recursive_biTree returns a list with the number of communities, tree path of each node, a list of node labels

recursive_biTree(
  A,
  cluster.labels.list,
  ncluster,
  cluster.labels,
  n.min,
  method
)

Arguments

A

It is the consensus graph (the long format of consensus matrix from consensus_build (node to node connection weight))
cluster.labels.list

To store a list of labels for each cluster during the process
ncluster

To store the number of clusters during the process
cluster.labels

A vector of labels for all the input nodes, the order should be consistent with the order of A
n.min

The minimum number of nodes for further partition
method

The partition method in spectral clustering

Value

a list with the number of communities, tree path of each node,a list of community labels for each community

Examples

library(dplyr,quietly=TRUE,warn.conflicts=FALSE)
library(igraph,quietly=TRUE,warn.conflicts=FALSE)

g <- graph_from_data_frame(consensus_dat,directed = F,vertices = NULL)
g <- simplify(g)
adj <- get.adjacency(g,type = "both",attr = "weight")

id_label <- bisbmresults[[1]] %>%
         filter(type=="id") %>%
         filter(level==0) %>%
         dplyr::select(node) %>%
         arrange(node)
id_label <- id_label$node

cluster.result <- recursive_biTree(adj,cluster.labels.list=list(),
                                   ncluster=0, cluster.labels=id_label,
                                   n.min=10,method="kmeans")

head(cluster.result[[1]])
